term: 105 ARNG Movement Type Goods Acceptance Processor
definition:
The 105 ARNG Movement Type Goods Acceptance Processor, is responsible for manually entering the Goods Acceptance into GFEBS. He/she reviews invoices proposed for payment using the Payment Warehouse program and blocks any invoices that ARNG does not want paid at that time. Any invoice not blocked are identified for payment by DFAS on the next payment run. Note: This role is only performed within the ARNG Payment Certification Process.

 Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Access Online (AXOL) is the online system used by US Bank to manage and maintain credit card accounts. Different levels of access are provided to individuals all directly correlated to their role with the credit card, i.e. managing account, cardholder, Agency Organization Program Coordinator (AOPC). 

 Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

Account Assignment is the charging of goods and/or services to a specific cost object and United States Standard General Ledger (USSGL) account on the Account Assignment tab of the PR, located in the item detail section.

 Lesson Referral - Purchase Requisitions

An accounting document is created parallel to the material document if the movement is relevant for financial accounting (that is, if it leads to an update of the general ledger accounts). In some cases, several accounting documents are created for a single material document.
 
 Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

AESIP is a source for all Vendor Master Data contained in CCR. With exceptions, every vendor doing business with the DoD is required to register and maintain their information at least once a year in the CCR database. The CCR database sends its vendor information to AESIP's database. AESIP manages a Master Data Management (MDM) database. This MDM database is the central data repository for Army-wide/global vendors. AESIP contains information necessary to create vendor master records in GFEBS. A CAGE code identifies vendor master data sent from AESIP.
 
 Lesson Referral - Master Data

Is a system that DFAS uses to process disbursements as part of the SDI. ADS processes payments for vendors in the Continental United States (CONUS). The PMS field on the invoice determines if ADS or DDS must be used t perform the disbursement. If the value in the PMS field is equal to "00" then ADS is used.
 
Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Automated Fund Control Order System (AFCOS) is a pay, travel order, and Miscellaneous Obligation Document (MOD) writing system for the National Guard Bureau (NGB).
 
Lesson Referral - Purchase Orders

Automatic Blocks are invoices which do not match the required obligation and/or GR are blocked by the system. These invoices remain blocked until the unmatched condition is corrected/resolved in GFEBS. Misc Pay Invoice remains blocked until approved by the Misc Pay Approver.
 
Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Each line on the AXOL 2-way Bulk PR will create a new eOrder in AXOL. Users can identify one line of accounting per line of accounting. Multiple transactions can be matched to an eOrder over the billing period and will not require a goods receipt.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

Each AXOL 2-way Single PR creates a single eOrder. Each Transaction will be initially distributed across each line of the eOrder according to the percentage of the line amounts in the eOrder. The cardholder can then redistribute the transaction once it is matched in the AXOL and it will not require a goods receipt.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

Each AXOL 3-way Single PR creates a Single eOrder. Each Transaction will be initially distributed across each line of the eOrder according to the percentage of the line amounts in the eOrder. The Cardholder can then redistribute the transaction once it is matched in AXOL and it will require a goods receipt. 

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) is an agreement used to allow approved agencies to order and pay for supplies and served from approved vendors several times a year using orders or calls.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Orders

A Blocked Invoice is an invoice that cannot be paid due to a mismatch against GFEBS obligation documents, such as the purchase order, funds commitment or goods receipt.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Cardholder Identifier is a 12-digit account Id (pseudo number) generated by Access Online which represents the actual charge card number.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

A Change Document is a document that details changes to master records, tables and documents.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Even though a user cannot change data on a material document once it has been posted, Change Material Document (MB02) is used to add additional information, including text.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Charge Card Master Record is the record in GFEBS which maintains card holder information such as the card holder name, unique card identifier (not the credit card number), EDIPI (common access card number) of card holder and managing account holder and the fund center for which the card holder will make purchases.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

A Commitment is an administrative reservation of funds based on firm procurement requests, orders or directives. 

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Consumption-Driven Planning (Material Requirement Planning) is a source of material master is the PP&E process step, Perform Material Forecast. 

Lesson Referral - Master Data

A Contractor and Government Entity (CAGE) Code is a five-position code that identifies contractors that do business with the Federal Government, North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) member nations and other foreign governments. The CAGE code supports various mechanized systems throughout the government and provides a standardized method for identifying a given facility at a specific location.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Controlling Area is a self-contained unit within a company or organization (e.g., Army) in which cost accounting can be performed. A controlling area is broken down into cost centers.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Corporate Electronic Funds Transfer (CEFT) is a database that provides the DoD with a single "repository" that houses remittance information (Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) and check remittance addresses) for contractor, military, civilian, travel and miscellaneous pay. 

Lesson Referral - Master Data

A Cost Center is an organizational unit of responsibility where costs can accumulate and be reported 

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Create Goods Movement (MIGO) creates a goods movement (such as goods receipt). It is an SAP Enjoy transaction, meaning a user can switch between multiple modes (create, display, change) on a single screen. 

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) is a system developed and regulated by Dun & Bradsheet (D&B) that assigns a unique numeric identifier to a single business entity. This numeric identifier then is referred to as a DUNS number. 

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Decremental Funding is used after a contract has been awarded (Post-Award), to decrease the funding on a GFEBS PR and ultimately in SPS as an Award Mod. It is used when the funds need to be temporarily reduced to be used for more critical requests.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

term: Defense Finance and Accounting Services (DFAS)/Defense Cash Accountability System (DCAS)
definition:
DCAS is the system selected by DFAS to be the single cash accountability system for the DoD. Cash accountability includes the reporting of disbursements, reimbursements, deposits and receipts to the U.S. Treasury. For the Payment process, the focus of this interface specifically is on the sending of SF 1081 transactions to DCAS.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Deployable Disbursing System (DDS) is a system that processes disbursements as part of the SDI. DDS will process payments for vendors Outside Continental United States (OCONUS). The PMS field on the invoice determines if ADS or DDS should be used to perform the disbursement. If the value in the PMS field is not equal to "00" then DDS is used.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Description Buy occurs when material master data is not present and is not needed. The service description is typed in the "short text" field of a PR in GFEBS. Purchasing services are completed through description buys because GFEBS does not maintain service master data.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Direct Cite Line Item is a MIPR Line Item accepted by the Performing Activity as Direct Cite Basis (Category II) - the requester's fund is cited directly on all documents needed to support the fulfillment of the MIPR Line Item. The requester's funds stay in the Commitment stage until a copy of the obligating document (e.g., contract award) is received back from the performing activity.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Orders

Disbursing Station Symbol Number (DSSN) is an identification number that indicates authority to receive and disburse public fund and issue checks on behalf of the Treasury of the United States (US). It is assigned to each disbursing office by the Treasury.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Cost Object is an object that collects costs or revenue for a particular purpose. Examples of this could be a Cost Center or Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) element.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Defense Security Assistance Management System (DSAMS-TM) is the management accounting system utilized to maintain management data related to the Security Assistance Training programs that the Security Assistance Training Field Activity (SATFA) manages for the Army.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Orders

Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) is a payment method that provides for automatic electronic transferral of funds, both payments and collections, thereby eliminating the need for a written check.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

An Element of Resource (EOR) is a four-digit code established by the Army Budget Office to categorize and track obligations and expenditures by items or services purchased.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

In the U.S., an EIN is the corporate equivalent to an SSN; it is issued to anyone, including individuals who have to pay withholding taxes on employees. Also known as the Tax Identification Number (TIN), the EIN is a unique nine-digit number assigned by the Internal Revenue Service to business entities that operate in the U.S. for the purpose of identification.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

With an eOrder, each card holder must create a PR prior to making a purchase with their credit card. Upon fund certification of a PR, a PO will auto-create and be sent to AXOL as an eOrder. The eOrder is used to match up a purchase and invoice in AXOL to the obligation in GFEBS.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

A European Article Number (EAN) or Universal Product Code (UPC) in the U.S. is an internationally standardized number that uniquely identifies a material. It always refers to a specific unit of measure or type of packaging such as "a pack of 10 pieces" or "a box." 

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Expired Funds are appropriations that are available for obligation for a definite period. Expired funds retain their fiscal year identity for five years after expiration.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Requisitions

term: Foreign Military Sales Interface Processing Monitor
definition: The Foreign Military Sales Interface Processing Monitor, is responsible for monitoring the interface for invoices from Defense Security Assistance Management System (DSAMS) and ensures the interface runs consistently and any errors are resolved accordingly. Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

FCM captures supply requisitions initiated by users in the SARSS and IRM, which are then sent to GFEBS where they are recorded as funds commitment documents via the Create Funds Commitment Document (FMZ1) transaction. 

Lesson Referral - Purchase Orders

GFEBS Non-Stock Materials are used for materials in which quantity is not tracked (e.g., spare parts for equipment).

Lesson Referral - Master Data

The GFEBS Operating Supplies material type consists of all materials in which quantity and value are inventoried. Value must be based on moving average cost. 

Lesson Referral - Master Data

A GFEBS Reimbursable material type is used mainly in the Reimbursable process to create reimbursable materials that are used during billing and when creating Sales Orders (i.e., labor, hours).

Lesson Referral - Master Data

The GFEBS Service material type can be used to record commonly- used services as a material (i.e., janitorial/cleaning services).

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Goods acceptance is the recording of the acceptance of goods and/or services in GFEBS. 

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Goods Issue is a type of goods movement with which a material withdrawal or issue, a material consumption or a shipment of goods to a customer is posted.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Goods movement is a transaction resulting in a change in stock (e.g., goods receipt and acceptance or goods issue).

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Goods Receipt is the recording of the receiving of goods and/or services in GFEBS. 

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Goods Receipts are entered into GFEBS two ways: (1) manually by the Goods Receipt Processor, or (2) automatically via interface with Wid Area Workflow (WAWF). The receipt and acceptance for goods and/or services are recorded in GFEBS in two ways: manually or automatically via interface with WAWF. The recording of the receipt and acceptance may occur simultaneously or separately, depending on the movement type.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

The Goods Receipt Interface Processing Monitor is the primary role involved in identification and resolution of any errors that may occur between GFEBS and WAWF interface.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Goods receipt and acceptance processing can occur simultaneously or can occur separately. Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 32.904 provides detailed acceptance criteria, including timing.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Goods Receipt Processor is the primary role involved with the Goods Receipt and Acceptance process in GFEBS and performs the followings tasks: Enters goods receipt and acceptance documents in GFEBS and enters goods reversal.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Processing Goods Reversal consists of reversing a goods receipt and acceptance. Reversals may correct errors in data entry or reflect a return of goods to vendor. Reversals created in WAWF do not automatically record in GFEBS via interface: they need a manual recording in both WAWF and GFEBS.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

The GR/IR Processor resolves the differences between and invoice and a GR.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Incremental Funding is used after a contract has been awarded (Post Award), to increase the funding on a GFEBS PR and ultimately in SPS as an Award Mod.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

GFEBS includes functionality that manages currency, exchange rates and revaluation. Exchange rates are required to translate transactions in foreign currencies to and from U.S. dollars. The exchange rates are provided daily (business days only) by the Treasury Department's International Treasury Services (ITS) in a Post Pay file. 

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

In GFEBS, inventory management covers the management (the recording and tracking) of stocks of materials on a quantity and values basis and the planning, entry and documentation of stock movements, such as goods receipts, goods issued, physical stock transfers and transfer postings.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

An Invoice is a commercial document that a seller issues to a buyer. The invoice indicates the products, quantities and agreed upon prices for products or services that the seller has already provided the buyer.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Invoice Interface Processing Monitor monitors the interfacing of invoices from WAWF and AXOL. The Invoice Interface Processing Monitor identifies and resolves any interface errors. In addition, the Invoice Processor releases invoices that are blocked and may coordinate with the Invoice Processor.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

The Invoice Processor receives, verifies and records contractual miscellaneous payment invoices in GFEBS at DFAS. This ensures all supporting information or documentation is legal, proper, complete and correct. In addition, the Invoice Processor can release invoices that are blocked for payment and may coordinate with the Invoice Interface Processing Monitor to help resolve interface errors.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

A Local Vendor is a supplier that is exempt or is not maintained in a vendor master interfacing system, such as Central Contractor Registration (CCR).

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Manual Blocks are Invoice Processors and 105 ARNG Movement Type Goods Acceptance Processor that can use the transaction code ZPTM_WAREHOUSE to identify, review, block and unblock invoices as necessary.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Master Data contains information that remains the same over time and that is often needed in the same form.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Matching is the action of comparing a vendor invoice to other GFEBS documents for verification and authorization, including the goods receipt, PO, funds commitment and/or goods receipt document.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Material Consumption is the quantity of an item consumed, lost or worn out beyond economical repair through normal appropriation and procurement lead time.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The material document serves as both proof of the goods movement and a source of information. It consists of a header and at least one item. The header contains general data about the goods movement (e.g., date). Each item describes one movement.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

A method of grouping similar materials. A material group is required for purchase requisitions and purchase orders. Some examples of material groups are Stockpile Materials or Equipment.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

A list of all the materials used by an enterprise for which a material master record has been created.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Material Master Data is vital descriptive information about a particular item (goods) for procurement purposes.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Material Master Data Controller enters Material Master Data manually on an exception basis. Updates material Master Data.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

term: Material Master Data Interface Processing Monitor
definition:
Material Master Data Interface Processing Monitor manages the interface between GFEBS and external systems where Material Master Data originates. Identifies and resolves interface errors.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A material number uniquely identifies a material master record, and thus, a material. GFEBS assigns unique material numbers automatically to all material master records. This acts as the identifier for that item.

Lesson Referral - Master Data / Spending Chain Introduction

Material Types are different types of material for which a material master record is created. A material type allows for the management of different materials in a uniform manner, and determines the screen sequence and field selection. An example of a material type is GFEBS Operating Supplies.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Material valuation determines or records the stock value of a material. The stock value is calculated using the formula: Stock value = stock quantity x material price.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Miscellaneous Payments are vendor invoices processed in GFEBS not related to a contract awarded in SPS.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Movement Type is a three-digit identification key for a goods movement (i.e., simultaneous goods receipt or goods acceptance, or goods receipt and goods acceptance treated as separate movements).

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

term: Movement Type 101: Enter Goods Receipt and Acceptance
definition:
Movement Type 101: Enter Goods Receipt and Acceptance  indicates that the goods and/or services delivered are intended either for the warehouse or for consumption and usage.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

term: Movement Type 103: Enter Goods Receipt in Blocked Stock
definition:
Movement Type 103: Enter Goods Receipt in Blocked Stock   is used to record the receipt of goods and services with the intent to record the acceptance of those goods or services at a later date. This movement type records goods and services to goods receipt- blocked stock.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Movement Type 105: Unrestricted Stock is executed when the conditions of acceptance for a delivery are met. The material can be released from goods receipt blocked stock and its goods receipt can be posted into unrestricted stock, thereby releasing the total quantity of the shipment for invoicing.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Non-DTS Travel encompasses all travel that is not administered in the Defense Travel System (DTS).

Lesson Referral - Purchase Order

A non-significant change is defined as a change that does not result in an overall dollar increase to the PR (i.e., decrease in quantity or price).

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Partial Funding is used when the full requirement is known and was previously communicated to contracting as "unfounded" (account assignment "U"), but only a portion of the funds are currently available.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Payment Certifier verifies the Payment Proposal prepared by the Payment Processor and determines if any corrections are necessary. Certifies the payment and performs Payment Run. Is the final authority and ultimately processes all payments set up by the Payment Processor. Re-routes the Payment Proposal back to the appropriate party for correction, if errors exist and allows the payments to be paid, or "blocks" the transactions from being paid with a manual payment block. Can remove payment blocks from vendor invoices when justified to do so.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

Payment Interface Processing Monitor is responsible for monitoring inbound and outbound payment interface. Routes information to and from the Payment Processor and Payment Certifier to resolve any errors.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

The Payment Processor sets the parameters (such as the date range) for payments to be placed within the Payment Proposal file.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

The Payment Program generates the payments identified in the Payment Proposal.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Payment Proposal is a display of proposed vendor invoice payments based on user-defined selection parameters. It differentiates between the various types of payments to be made.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

The Payment Run is the step that generates payment files for transmittal to disbursing systems containing only those items that were certified for payment.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Payment Warehouse is a transaction that allows for multiple users to identify, review and block or unblock invoices for a given payment run date.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Performing Material Configuration is the creation and maintenance of material master records for use by GFEBS business processes.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Prompt Payment Act (PPA) is a statute that requires Federal agencies to pay their bills on a timely basis, to pay interest penalties when payments are made late and to take discounts only when payments are made by the discount date.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Post Invoice activity addresses the processing of all invoices whether or not they are subject to PPA.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Post-Pay File is an inbound file that contains data on disbursements made by ADS or DDS on behalf of GFEBS.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

PowerTrack (Transportation)  is a third party, commercial payment tool owned by U.S. Bank. A bulk obligation is manually entered in GFEBS to represent each Transportation Accounting Code (TAC) using the Create Funds Commitment Document (FMZ1) transaction.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Order

PR Approval Workflow -  A sequence of steps triggered by the creation of a Standard Procurement System (SPS), Outbound MIPR or Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support (DMLSS) PR which results in a fully- approved and fund-certified PR.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

PR Modification makes changes to the PR that originate after it was saved and submitted to the contracting office.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Purchase Requisition (PR) is a document that records a request for the purchase of goods and/or services and that results in a commitment of funds.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Purchase Requisition Approval Maintainer maintains a table of all Purchase Requisition Approvers. The table helps ensure that the PR workflow sends the PR to the appropriate Purchase Requisition Approvers within an organization.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Purchase Requisition Approver reviews, validates and approves PRs. Depending on the release strategy, the PR approval workflow carries the PR through a sequence of approvers that always end with the Purchase Requisition Funds Certifier.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Purchase Requisition Funds Certifier ensures the proper funds are cited on the PR. This role is performed by Resources Management (RM). Once certified, the PR is saved and funds are committed.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Purchase Requisition Interface Processing Monitor resolves errors with the inbound interface of PRs from the DMLSS system and also resolves errors with the outbound interface of PRs to the SPS contract writing system.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Purchase Requisition Processor serves as the PR initiator, receiving and validating requirements and entering the PR. The Purchase Requisition Processor also makes changes and corrections to PRs as required. They coordinate with the Purchase Requisition Interface Processing Monitor in the event of interface errors.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Ready-to-Pay File contains payment transactions generated by the Payment Program sent to ADS or DDS for disbursement.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A return happens if the merchant issues a refund for a purchase, the cardholder should match the refund to an existing eOrder. The return will fail if the amount being credited exceeds the amount of the original invoice. eOrders will be available for 6 billing cycles; if the return occurred after the 6 billing cycles, you will need to match it to another eOrder ensuring it doesn't exceed the amount of the invoice for that bill.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

A US Bank-issued rebate will require a new GFEBS PR designated by the Account Assignment R (amount should reflect the total amount of the rebate). The PR will the proceed through the normal Workflow Process which will create a PO and eOrder. Rebate PR and PO lines will not commit or obligate funds.

Lesson Referral - Government Purchase Card

A Reimbursable Line Item is an MIPR Line Item accepted by the Performing Activity on a Reimbursable basis - the Performing Activity fulfills the MIPR requirement "in-house."

Lesson Referral - Purchase Order

A Release Strategy is a predetermined routing path based on certain characteristics or the PR document on which the PR Approval Workflow is built.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Routing Identification Code (RIC) is assigned by services/agencies for processing inter- service/agency and intra-service/agency logistics transactions. The codes serve multiple purposes in that they are the source of supply codes, inter- system routing codes, intra-system routing codes and consignor (shipper) codes.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Significant Charge (PR) - A significant change is defined as a change that results in an overall dollar increase to the PR (i.e., increase in quantity or price).

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Site Invoice Processor receives, verifies and creates manual non-contractual miscellaneous payment invoices in GFEBS at the installation. This ensures that miscellaneous payment invoices that are not subject to Prompt Payment Act are accurate and meet requirements. Furthermore, the Site Invoice Processor can release non-contractual invoices that are blocked for payment.

Lesson Referral - Accounts Payable

SF 182 - Standard Form (SF) 182 - Authorization, Agreement and Certification of Training.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Order

Stock refers to the quantities of materials in a company's storage facilities. Also called "inventory."

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Stock Amount is an account that records the opening quantity of stock in a warehouse, goods issues and receipts and the closing stock.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

The System for Award Management (SAM) is a Federal Government owned and operated free web site that consolidates the capabilities in CCR/FEDReg, ORCA and EPLS. Future phases of SAM will add the capabilities of other systems used in Federal procurement and awards processes.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

Tolerance is when goods receipt quantity (quantity of goods) is greater than the purchase order quantity. If a vendor ships a greater quantity than what was ordered, the Army accepts only what is on the purchase order, which is the obligating document.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

Transportation Account Code (TAC) identifies the appropriate Department of Defense (DoD) component and appropriation chargeable for movement of material.

Lesson Referral - Purchase Order

A vendor is any person or organization that provides goods and services to the Army, including employees.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

A Vendor Account Group defines the fields and vendor numbering in the vendor master record. It also specifies the grouping of fields required for certain types of vendors.

Lesson Referral - Master Data/Spending Chain Introduction

Vendor Master Data - Contains basic information about a vendor that conducts business with the Army.  

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

The Vendor Master Data Controller enters Vendor Master Data manually on an exception basis. Updates Material Master Data.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

term: Vendor Master Data Interface Processing Monitor
definition:
The Vendor Master Data Interface Processing Monitor manages the interface between GFEBS and external systems where Vendor Master Data originates. Identifies and resolves interface errors.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

The Vendor Master Data Interface Processing Monitor manages the interface between GFEBS and external systems where Vendor Master Data originates. Identifies and resolves interface errors.

Lesson Referral - Master Data

The WAWF is a web-based application which allows Contracting Officers (Kos) and Contracting Officer Representatives (CORs) to perform a Goods Receipts and Acceptance on delivered goods and services.

Lesson Referral - Goods Receipt

A WBS Element describes project tasks or sub-tasks that are to be performed within a defined time.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction

Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) is a hierarchical outline of an undertaking described in the project definition. The WBS is the basis for the organization and coordination of a project. A WBS consists of WBS elements. The WBS elements describe project tasks or sub-tasks that are to be performed within a defined time.

Lesson Referral - Spending Chain Introduction
